Measure Name: Adult Body Mass Index Assessment: Ages 18-74

Domain: Care of Acute and Chronic Conditions
Measure Name: PQI 01: Diabetes Short-Term Complications Admission Rate: Age 18 and Older
Rate Definition: Inpatient Hospital Admissions for Diabetes Short-Term Complications per 100,000 Enrollee Months: Ages 18-64
State Specific Comments: Rate includes FFS and managed care populations (3 MCOs). Rate excludes Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. State did not use Major Diagnostic Category (MDC) Code Admit = 14 (Pregnancy, Childbirth, and Puerperium), and instead used the ICD 9 and 10 diagnosis codes in the Pregnancy Value Set. State did not use admission source codes for transfers from other hospitals or health facilities (including long-term care), and instead used codes for transfers from an ambulatory surgical center and transfers from hospice in the Point of Origin field of claims.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Domain: Care of Acute and Chronic Conditions
Measure Name: PQI 05: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) or Asthma in Older Adults Admission Rate: Age 40 and Older
Rate Definition: Inpatient Hospital Admissions for Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) or Asthma per 100,00 Enrollee Months: Ages 40-64
State Specific Comments: Rate includes FFS and managed care populations (3 MCOs). Rate excludes Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. State replaced codes for the numerator with the following Value Sets: Acute Inpatient, COPD, and Asthma. State did not use Major Diagnostic Category (MDC) Code Admit =14 (Pregnancy, Childbirth, and Puerperium), and instead used the Pregnancy and Pregnancy Diagnosis Value Sets. State did not use Diagnosis-Related Group (DRG) Grouper for cystic fibrosis or anomalies of the respiratory system, and instead used the Cystic Fibrosis Value Set. State did not use admission source codes for transfers from other hospitals or health facilities (including long-term care), and instead used codes for transfers from an ambulatory surgical center and transfers from hospice in the Point of Origin claims field.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Domain: Care of Acute and Chronic Conditions
Measure Name: PQI 01: Diabetes Short-Term Complications Admission Rate: Age 18 and Older
Rate Definition: Inpatient Hospital Admissions for Diabetes Short-Term Complications per 100,000 Enrollee Months: Ages 18-64
State Specific Comments: Rate includes FFS and managed care populations (3 MCOs). Rate excludes Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. State identified transfers using claims data, defining a transfer as a discharge date with a subsequent admission on the same day or the next day. Transfers from a Skilled Nursing Facility or Intermediate Care Facility are identified using enrollment level of care start and stop dates. Numerator excludes admission dates that have an inpatient discharge from another facility or a facility level of care stop date on the day before or the day of the admission date.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

State Specific Comments: Rate includes managed care population (7 MCOs), representing 66 percent of the population. Rate excludes FFS population and enrollees in one MCO, representing 34 percent of the population, and Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. Denominator excludes women with gestational diabetes. Domain: Care of Acute and Chronic Conditions
Measure Name: PQI 08: Heart Failure Admission Rate: Age 18 and Older
Rate Definition: Inpatient Hospital Admissions for Heart Failure per 100,000 Enrollee Months: Ages 18-64
State Specific Comments: Rate includes FFS and managed care populations (3 MCOs). Rate excludes Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. State replaced codes for the numerator with the following Value Sets: Heart Failure and Acute Inpatient. State did not use diagnosis codes listed for cardiac procedures, and instead used the Cardiac Procedures Value Set. State did not use Major Diagnostic Category (MDC) Code Admit = 14 (Pregnancy, Childbirth, and Puerperium), and instead used the Pregnancy and Pregnancy Diagnosis Value Sets. State did not use admission source codes for transfers from other hospitals or health facilities (including long-term care), and instead used codes for transfers from an ambulatory surgical center and transfers from hospice in the Point of Origin claims field.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Domain: Care of Acute and Chronic Conditions
Measure Name: PQI 01: Diabetes Short-Term Complications Admission Rate: Age 18 and Older
Rate Definition: Inpatient Hospital Admissions for Diabetes Short-Term Complications per 100,000 Enrollee Months: Ages 18-64
State Specific Comments: Rate includes managed care population (9 MCOs). Rate excludes Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. Age was determined as of discharge date. State provided MCOs with the following guidelines for calculating the measure: (1) include enrollees enrolled in the MCO at some point during the inpatient stay and that continuous enrollment is not required; (2) provide the enrollment and disenrollment segment that overlaps with the stay and contiguous segments should be linked to show the longest continuous enrollment segment for the enrollee that overlaps with the inpatient stay; and (3) include paid and denied charges, and exclude events that were denied because the enrollee was not a member of the MCO during the stay.  Data were submitted by MCOs and compiled by the state's EQRO.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Measure Name: Controlling High Blood Pressure: Ages 18-85
Rate Definition: Percentage who had a Diagnosis of Hypertension and Whose Blood Pressure was Adequately Controlled (<140/90 mmHg) During the Measurement Year: Ages 18-64
State Specific Comments: Rate was calculated using Meaningful Use 2016 electronic Clinical Quality Measure (eCQM) Specifications for Eligible Professionals. Rate includes managed care population (16 CCOs) ages 18 to 85 who are included in Electronic Health Records in the state, representing 75 percent of the population. Rate excludes FFS population and managed care enrollees who are not included in electronic health record data, representing 25 percent of the population.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Numerators exclude transitional care management follow-up visits.

Domain: Care of Acute and Chronic Conditions
Measure Name: PQI 15: Asthma in Younger Adults Admission Rate: Ages 18-39
Rate Definition: Inpatient Hospital Admissions for Asthma per 100,000 Enrollee-Months: Ages 18-39
State Specific Comments: Rate includes FFS and managed care populations (3 MCOs). Rate excludes Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. State replaced codes for the numerator with the following Value Sets: Asthma and Acute Inpatient. State did not use Major Diagnostic Category (MDC) Code Admit = 14 (Pregnancy, Childbirth, and Puerperium), and instead used Pregnancy and Pregnancy Diagnosis Value Set. State did not use Diagnosis-Related Group (DRG) Grouper for cystic fibrosis or anomalies of the respiratory system, and instead used the Cystic Fibrosis Value Set. State did not use admission source codes for transfers from other hospitals or health facilities (including long-term care), and instead used codes for transfers from an ambulatory surgical center and transfers from hospice in the Point of Origin claims field.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Domain: Care of Acute and Chronic Conditions
Measure Name: PQI 05: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) or Asthma in Older Adults Admission Rate: Age 40 and Older
Rate Definition: Inpatient Hospital Admissions for Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) or Asthma per 100,00 Enrollee Months: Ages 40-64
State Specific Comments: Rate includes managed care population (9 MCOs) age 40 and older. Rate excludes Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. Age was determined as of discharge date. State provided MCOs with the following guidelines for calculating the measure: (1) include enrollees enrolled in the MCO at some point during the inpatient stay and that continuous enrollment is not required; (2) provide the enrollment and disenrollment segment that overlaps with the stay and contiguous segments should be linked to show the longest continuous enrollment segment for the enrollee that overlaps with the inpatient stay; and (3) include paid and denied charges, and exclude events that were denied because the enrollee was not a member of the MCO during the stay. Data were submitted by MCOs and compiled by the state's EQRO.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Domain: Care of Acute and Chronic Conditions
Measure Name: PQI 08: Heart Failure Admission Rate: Age 18 and Older
Rate Definition: Inpatient Hospital Admissions for Heart Failure per 100,000 Enrollee Months: Ages 18-64
State Specific Comments: Rate includes managed care population (9 MCOs). Rate excludes Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. State provided MCOs with the following guidelines for calculating the measure: (1) include enrollees enrolled in the MCO at some point during the inpatient stay and that continuous enrollment is not required; (2) provide the enrollment and disenrollment segment that overlaps with the stay and contiguous segments should be linked to show the longest continuous enrollment segment for the enrollee that overlaps with the inpatient stay; and (3) include paid and denied charges, and exclude events that were denied because the enrollee was not a member of the MCO during the stay. Data were submitted by MCOs and compiled by the state's EQRO.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Domain: Care of Acute and Chronic Conditions
Measure Name: PQI 15: Asthma in Younger Adults Admission Rate: Ages 18-39
Rate Definition: Inpatient Hospital Admissions for Asthma per 100,000 Enrollee-Months: Ages 18-39
State Specific Comments: Rate includes managed care population (9 MCOs). Rate excludes Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. Age was determined as of discharge date. State provided MCOs with the following guidelines for calculating the measure: (1) include enrollees enrolled in the MCO at some point during the inpatient stay and that continuous enrollment is not required; (2) provide the enrollment and disenrollment segment that overlaps with the stay and contiguous segments should be linked to show the longest continuous enrollment segment for the enrollee that overlaps with the inpatient stay; and (3) include paid and denied charges, and exclude events that were denied because the enrollee was not a member of the MCO during the stay. Data were submitted by MCOs and compiled by the state's EQRO.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Rate Definition: Percentage with Diabetes (Type 1 or Type 2) who had Hemoglobin A1c in Poor Control (>9.0%): Ages 18-64
State Specific Comments: Rate includes managed care population (4 MCOs) ages 18 to 75. Rate excludes Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. Denominator is the sample size; measure-eligible population is 52,972. Rate was validated by the state's EQRO.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Domain: Behavioral Health Care
Measure Name: Follow-Up After Hospitalization for Mental Illness: Age 21 and Older
Rate Definition: Percentage of Hospitalizations for Mental Illness with a Follow-Up Visit Within 7 Days of Discharge: Ages 21-64
State Specific Comments: Rates include FFS and managed care populations (24 MCOs) age 21 and older. Rates exclude Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. Rates were validated by the state's EQRO.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Domain: Care of Acute and Chronic Conditions
Measure Name: Comprehensive Diabetes Care: Hemoglobin A1c Testing: Ages 18-75
Rate Definition: Percentage with Diabetes (Type 1 or Type 2) who had a Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) Test: Ages 18-64
State Specific Comments: Rate includes managed care population (2 MCOs) ages 18 to 75, representing 87 percent of the population. Rate excludes FFS and PCCM populations, representing 13 percent of the population, and Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. Denominator is the sample size; measure-eligible population is 8,896.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Domain: Behavioral Health Care
Measure Name: Follow-Up After Hospitalization for Mental Illness: Age 21 and Older
Rate Definition: Percentage of Hospitalizations for Mental Illness with a Follow-Up Visit Within 7 Days of Discharge: Ages 21-64
State Specific Comments: Rates include FFS and managed care populations (4 MCOs). Continuous enrollment criteria were not applied because the state cannot assess enrollment on specific dates. Denominator includes discharges that occurred during the last month of the measurement year. Rates exclude discharges followed by a direct transfer to another acute care facility or a readmission for diagnosis within 30 days of discharge. Numerator includes the following provider types: 20-23 (mental health facilities), 365 (psychiatry), 458 (child psychiatry), 824 (psychiatric nurse), 853 (supportive therapists), and 860 (psychologist). Denominator includes beneficiaries who were ages 21 to 64 at any time during the measurement year. Rates include paid claims only.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Measure Name: Antidepressant Medication Management: Age 18 and Older
Rate Definition: Percentage Diagnosed with Major Depression who were Treated with and Remained on Antidepressant Medication for 12 Weeks: Ages 18-64
State Specific Comments: Rates include FFS population. Rates exclude Medicare-Medicaid Dual Eligibles. State attributes higher performance on this measure to its high rate of community mental health services per capita and state collaboration with designated agencies that serve Medicaid beneficiaries with mental illness.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.

Rate Definition: Percentage of Hospitalizations for Mental Illness with a Follow-Up Visit Within 30 Days of Discharge: Ages 21-64
State Specific Comments: Rates include FFS population. Administrative data sources are MMIS and encounter data from the state Department of Mental Health Monthly Service Report (MSR) database. State developed a crosswalk between the HEDIS technical specifications and the MSR database to create "HEDIS-like" rates that more accurately capture the follow-up visits by beneficiaries. Rates and methodology were validated by the state's EQRO.
Source: Mathematica analysis of MACPro reports for the FFY 2017 reporting cycle as of November 1, 2018.
